title: Mohamed Salah returns from ankle injury for Champions League clash but Liverpool without two key defenders
text:
Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah has recovered from an ankle injury to take his place in the squad for Wednesday’s Champions League group fixture in Belgium.

The Egyptian missed his side’s 1-1 draw with Manchester United but was named in the travelling party as Jurgen Klopp’s side headed to Genk.

Salah is now expected to play, although Klopp has other injury concerns as Trent Alexander-Arnold is ill and Joel Matip has remained on Merseyside for treatment on a knee injury.

That means Joe Gomez and Dejan Lovren are likely to step into a reshuffled defence, although Klopp does have the option of using James Milner as full-back.

Liverpool cannot afford a slip-up after losing to Napoli in their first game, albeit they secured a 4-3 win over Salzburg to put themselves in a stronger position to qualify.
description: Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah has recovered from an ankle injury to take his place in the squad for Wednesday’s Champions League group fixture in Belgium.
